intro: Cuspidaria weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, characterized by its erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the spurge family. Cuspidaria weberbaueri is adapted to high-altitude environments, often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
